news_header: A trade strike began in logistics on Monday and will extend to stores on Wednesday, involving around 70,000 employees across 3,000 locations. The strike is set to last until Thursday morning for logistics and Saturday morning for stores.
news_original_title: Kaupan alan lakot alkoivat maanantaina – ”Ruoka ei tule loppumaan Suomesta”, sanoo Kaupan liiton johtaja
news_text: PAM seeks wage increases to restore workers' purchasing power, but negotiations have stalled. The union emphasizes that food supplies in Finland will not be affected, and the extent of store operations during the strike will depend on staff participation.
